perturbation.original_text: This Manufacturing Outsourcing Agreement (The "AGREEMENT") is entered into on January 21st, 2002, by and between Nice Systems Ltd., an Israeli registered corporation no. 52-0036872 having its place of business at 8 Hapnina Street, P.O.B 690, Ra'anana 43107, Israel, ("NICE") and Flextronics Israel Ltd., an Israeli registered corporation no. 51-2933045, having its place of business at 1 Hatasiya Str., Ramat Gabriel Industrial Zone, Migdal Haemek 23108, P.O.Box 867, Israel (the "CONTRACTOR"). NICE and Contractor are collectively referred to as the Parties.
perturbation.changed_text: This Manufacturing Outsourcing Agreement (The "AGREEMENT") is entered into on January 21st, 2002, by and between Nice Systems Ltd., an Israeli registered corporation no. 52-0036872 having its place of business at 8 Hapnina Street, P.O.B 690, Ra'anana 43107, Israel, ("NICE") and Flextronics Israel Ltd., an Israeli registered corporation no. 51-2933045, having its place of business at 1 Hatasiya Str., Ramat Gabriel Industrial Zone, Migdal Haemek 23108, P.O.Box 867, Israel (the "SERVICE PROVIDER"). NICE and Contractor are collectively referred to as the Parties.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Contractor' is replaced by 'Service Provider' in the initial definition, while 'Contractor' is used throughout the rest of the document. This introduces ambiguity as it is not clear whether Contractor and Service Provider are to be treated as the same entity. This can lead to uncertainty about which entity is responsible for fulfilling specific obligations in the contract.

perturbation.original_text: (x)  "CUSTOMER/S" - NICE distributors, resellers, VAR's (value added           resellers), OEM's and similar business partners and/or end-users,           which purchase the Products.
perturbation.changed_text: (x)  "CLIENT/S" - NICE distributors, resellers, VAR's (value added           resellers), OEM's and similar business partners and/or end-users,           which purchase the Products.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'CUSTOMER' is replaced by 'CLIENT' in the definition, while 'Customer' is used throughout the rest of the document. This introduces ambiguity as it is not clear whether Customer and Client are to be treated as the same entity. This can lead to uncertainty about which party certain rights and obligations apply to.

perturbation.original_text: NICE shall give Contractor a written forecast of the                Products, by type, quantity and expected Due Date (the                "FORECAST") as follows: A Forecast shall be a rolling forecast                for the current Quarter and the two (2) consecutive Quarters,                detailed by week.
perturbation.changed_text: NICE shall give Contractor a written projection of the                Products, by type, quantity and expected Due Date (the                "FORECAST") as follows: A Forecast shall be a rolling forecast                for the current Quarter and the two (2) consecutive Quarters,                detailed by week.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'forecast' is replaced by 'projection' while the term 'FORECAST' is still used in the rest of the document. This introduces ambiguity as it is not clear whether the term 'projection' is the same thing as the term 'FORECAST'. This can lead to uncertainty about which part of the article the contract is referring to when the term 'FORECAST' is used.
